meanings.definition: To move backward while appearing to walk forward, as if on the moon.
meanings.sent1: She moonwalked across the room, gliding effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: He moonwalked at the talent show, impressing everyone with his smooth moves.
meanings.sent3: The penguin moonwalked on the icy surface, trying to keep up with the other birds.
meanings.sent4: The robot moonwalked through the crowd, drawing attention with its unique style.
meanings.sent5: The ghost moonwalked through the walls, leaving a trail of confusion behind.

meanings.definition: Past tense of moonwalk: to have moved backward while appearing to walk forward, as if on the moon.
meanings.sent1: They moonwalked across the stage last night, showcasing their dance skills.
meanings.sent2: After the party, she moonwalked home in the dark, feeling like a star.
meanings.sent3: The cat moonwalked into the room, surprising everyone with its agility.
meanings.sent4: The car moonwalked out of the parking lot, smoothly maneuvering through traffic.
meanings.sent5: The idea moonwalked into his mind, sparking a wave of creativity.
